intro: Rosa elatophylla, commonly known as the pink sandalwood rose, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California, where it thrives in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It has small, elliptical leaves that are leathery in texture and often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Rosa elatophylla is well adapted to coastal conditions, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
